headline: Apple's AI shakeup: They might not be 'moving the needle' on AI
summary: Apple (AAPL) is shaking up its AI executives, according to a Bloomberg report, as the tech giant prioritizes its artificial intelligence offerings. The company has delayed the launch of its AI-enhanced Siri digital assistant until 2026. TechRadar Editor-At-Large Lance Ulanoff sits down with Josh Lipton to talk more about Apple's strategy around AI and its integration into devices. A report from The Information also outlined how the iPhone maker is losing $1 billion each year on its Apple TV+ streaming service. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here.

headline: Apple, in effort to turn around Siri, shakes up executive ranks, Bloomberg says
summary: Apple (AAPL) CEO Tim Cook lost faith in AI head John Giannandrea to execute on product development and drafted in Vision Pro creator Mike Rockwell to oversee Siri, Bloomberg’s Mark Gurman reports. In a new role, Rockwell will be in charge of the Siri virtual assistant and will report to software chief Craig Federighi, according to people familiar with the matter. Apple is expected to announce the changes to employees this week, Gurman writes. Rockwell is currently the vice president in charge of

headline: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
summary: ChatGPT, OpenAI’s text-generating AI chatbot, has taken the world by storm since its launch in November 2022. What started as a tool to supercharge productivity through writing essays and code with short text prompts has evolved into a behemoth with 300 million weekly active users. 2024 was a big year for OpenAI, from its partnership with Apple for its generative AI offering, Apple Intelligence, the release of GPT-4o with voice capabilities, and the highly-anticipated launch of its text-to-video

headline: Cloud AI Today - NVIDIA Google Partnership Advances AI Innovation and Infrastructure
summary: NVIDIA, Alphabet, and Google have announced new collaborations to advance the field of agentic and physical AI. These initiatives, revealed at the NVIDIA GTC global AI conference, aim to democratize access to AI tools and accelerate development in areas such as robotics, drug discovery, and energy optimization. By leveraging NVIDIA's platforms like Omniverse and Isaac, and integrating Google's advanced AI systems, the partnership seeks to enhance the trust and performance of generative AI...
